member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizer
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant root interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizer.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizer.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant acquistion interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.Initiate
member.summary: Initiates a waveform acquisition. The digitizer leaves the Idle state and waits for a trigger. The digitizer acquires a waveform for each enabled channel.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.Abort
member.summary: Aborts an acquisition and returns the digitizer to the Idle state.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.WaitForAcquisitionComplete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits until the configured acquisition is complete. If no acquisition is currently running, this function returns immediately. If the acquisition does not complete within the time period the user specified with the MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter, the function returns the Max Time Exceeded error.
member.param: Specifies the maximum time the end-user allows for this function to complete. The units are milliseconds. Defined values: Max Time Infinite - The function waits indefinitely for the acquisition to complete.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.ConfigureAcquisition(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the most commonly configured attributes of the digitizer acquisition sub-system. These attributes are the samples per record, the number of records, and the sample rate.
member.param: Specifies the number of records in the acquisition. This value sets the Num Records to Acquire attribute.
Specifies the number of samples in each record. This value sets the Record Size attribute.
Specifies the sample rate in samples per second. This value sets the Sample Rate attribute.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.QueryMinWaveformMemory(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: This function is used to determine the minimum amount of memory that is needed to fetch or read data from the digitizer with maximum performance.
member.param: Specifies the size of the sampled data that will be retrieved. The value of this parameter must be 8, 16, 32 or 64, corresponding to the intended Read/Fetch function.
Specifies the number of records that will be read.
Specifies the start index within the record from which the data should be retrieved.
Specifies the number of data points to return.
member.returns: The minimum buffer size in samples needed for a subsequent Read or Fetch call with the same readout parameters.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.MaxSamplesPerChannel
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of samples per channel that can be captured.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.NumAcquiredRecords
member.summary: Gets the total number of records acquired since the acquistion was last initiated. You may call this method while an acquisition is in progress.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.SampleRate
member.summary: Specifies the rate of the sample clock in samples per second. This number represents the inverse of the interval between samples in the acquisition record.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.TimeInterleavedChannelListAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the instrument should automatically combine enabled channels to satisfy user-specified sample rates. When set to True, the instrument will automatically combine channels to meet the sample rate requirements specified via the Sample Rate attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.MinRecordSize
member.summary: Indicates the minimum waveform record size. If the digitizer can support any arbitrary size record, then this attribute returns 1.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.RecordSize
member.summary: Specifies the number of samples to acquire in each waveform record.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.NumRecordsToAcquire
member.summary: Specifies the number of waveform records to acquire. One waveform record is acquired for each recognized trigger.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.SampleMode
member.summary: Specifies the sample mode used by the digitizer.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.Status
member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus interface.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisition.MaxFirstValidPointValue
member.summary: Returns the maximum value that the First Valid Point parameter of the readout functions may assume. This value is necessary to calculate the minimum size of the required data buffer to retrieved the entire acquisition.

member.summary: Specifies the source the digitizer monitors for the trigger event. The value specified here must be one of the valid repeated capability names for the TriggerSource repeated capability.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.MultiTrigger
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDigitizerMultiTrigger interface.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.Sources
member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDigitizerTriggerSources interface.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.Modifier
member.summary: Specifies the trigger modifier. The trigger modifier determines the digitizer's behavior in the absence of the configured trigger.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.PretriggerSamples
member.summary: Specifies the number of samples that must be collected before a trigger event will be recognized. The Pretrigger Samples attribute affects instrument operation only when the digitizer requires multiple acquisitions to build a complete waveform. If Trigger Holdoff and Pretrigger Samples are are both non-zero, then both conditions must be satisfied before the digitizer will accept a trigger.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.Holdoff
member.summary: Specifies the length of time the digitizer waits after it detects a trigger until the digitizer enables the trigger subsystem to detect another trigger. The units are seconds. The Trigger Holdoff attribute affects instrument operation only when the digitizer requires multiple acquisitions to build a complete waveform. If Trigger Holdoff and PreTriggerSamples are are both non-zero, then both conditions must be satisfied before the digitizer will accept a trigger. Note: Many digitizers have a small, non-zero value as the minimum value for this attribute. To configure the instrument to use the shortest trigger hold-off, the user can specify a value of zero for this attribute. Therefore, the IVI Class-Compliant specific driver shall coerce any value between zero and the minimum value to the minimum value. No other coercion is allowed on this attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the length of time from the trigger event to the first point in the waveform record. If the value is positive, the first point in the waveform record occurs after the trigger event. If the value is negative, the first point in the waveform record occurs before the trigger event. The units are seconds.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTrigger.OutputEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether or not an accepted trigger appears at an output of the digitizer.

member.summary: This attribute is used to combine this channel with one or more other channels to achieve higher effective sampling rates and/or greater memory depth. The string provided here specifies which channels should operate in combined mode with the current channel. This attribute is a comma-separated list of two one or more channel names.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannel.Downconversion

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannel.DataInterleavedChannelList
member.summary: This attribute is used to combine this channel with one or more other channels to interleave the returned data. The string provided here specifies which channels should operate in combined mode with the current channel.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannel.InputConnectorSelection
member.summary: Some digitizers include multiple connectors for each digitizer input channel. These connectors are often simply a matter of convenience for system cabling ? multiple signals can be routed to the various connectors, the the desired signal can be sent into the digitizer by changing an internal switch. With other digitizers, the connectors may be of different types or even different impedances. This attribute is used to determine which connector is to be used.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerEdge
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant edge triggering interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerEdge.Configure(System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSlopeEnum)
member.summary: This function sets the edge triggering attributes. An edge trigger occurs when the trigger signal that the end-user specifies with the Source parameter passes through the voltage threshold that the end-user specifies with the level parameter and has the slope that the end-user specifies with the Slope parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the Trigger Type is Edge Trigger. Set the Trigger Type and Trigger Coupling before calling this function. If the trigger source is one of the analog input channels, an application program should configure the vertical range, vertical coupling, probe attenuation, and the maximum input frequency before calling this function.
member.param: Specifies the trigger level. This value sets the Trigger Level attribute.
Specifies the trigger slope. This value sets the Trigger Slope attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerEdge.Slope
member.summary: Specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the digitizer. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the Trigger Type attribute is set to Edge Trigger.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerGlitch
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant glitch triggering interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerGlitch.Configure(System.Double,System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchPolarityEnum,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionEnum)
member.summary: This function configures the glitch trigger. A glitch trigger occurs when the trigger signal has a pulse with a width that is less than or greater than the glitch width. The end user specifies which comparison criterion to use with the GlitchCondition parameter. The end-user specifies the glitch width with the GlitchWidth parameter. The end-user specifies the polarity of the pulse with the GlitchPolarity parameter. The trigger does not actually occur until the edge of a pulse that corresponds to the GlitchWidth and GlitchPolarity crosses the threshold the end-user specifies in the TriggerLevel parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the trigger type is Glitch Trigger. Set the trigger type and trigger coupling before calling this function.
member.param: Specifies the trigger level. This value sets the Trigger Level attribute.
Specifies the glitch triggering glitch width in seconds. This value sets the Glitch Width attribute.
Specifies the glitch polarity. This value sets the Glitch Polarity attribute.
Specifies the glitch condition. This value sets the Glitch Condition attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerGlitch.Width
member.summary: Specifies the glitch width. The units are seconds. The digitizer triggers when it detects a pulse with a width less than or greater than this value, depending on the Glitch Condition attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerGlitch.Condition
member.summary: Specifies the glitch condition. This attribute determines whether the glitch trigger happens when the digitizer detects a pulse with a width less than or greater than the width value.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerGlitch.Polarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the glitch that triggers the digitizer.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerRunt
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant runt triggering interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerRunt.Configure(System.Double,System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum)
member.summary: This function configures the runt trigger. A runt trigger occurs when the trigger signal crosses one of the runt thresholds twice without crossing the other runt threshold. The end-user specifies the runt thresholds with the RuntLowThreshold and RuntHighThreshold parameters. The end-user specifies the polarity of the runt with the RuntPolarity parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the trigger type is Runt Trigger. Set the trigger type and trigger coupling before calling this function.
member.param: Sets the runt triggering low threshold in volts.
Sets the runt triggering high threshold in volts.
Sets the runt polarity.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerRunt.Polarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the runt that triggers the digitizer.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerRunt.ThresholdHigh
member.summary: The high threshold the digitizer uses for runt triggering. The units are Volts.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerRunt.ThresholdLow
member.summary: The low threshold the digitizer uses for runt triggering. The units are Volts.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant TV triggering interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV.Configure(Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTVSignalFormatEnum,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTVTriggerEventEnum,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTVTriggerPolarityEnum)
member.summary: This function configures the digitizer for TV triggering. It configures the TV signal format, the event and the signal polarity. This function affects instrument behavior only if the trigger type is TV Trigger. Set the Trigger Type and Trigger Coupling before calling this function.
member.param: Specifies the TV trigger signal format. This value sets the TV Trigger Signal Format attribute.
Specifies the TV trigger event. This value sets the TV Trigger Event attribute.
Specifies the polarity of the TV trigger. This value sets the TV Trigger Polarity attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV.Polarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the TV signal.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV.Event
member.summary: Specifies the event on which the digitizer triggers.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV.LineNumber
member.summary: Specifies the line on which the digitizer triggers. The driver uses this attribute when the TV Trigger Event is set to TV Event Line Number. The line number setting is independent of the field. This means that to trigger on the first line of the second field, the user must configure the line number to the value of 263 (if we presume that field one had 262 lines).

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerTV.SignalFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of TV signal on which the digitizer triggers.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerWidth
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant width triggering interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerTriggerWidth.Configure(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEnum,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthConditionEnum)
member.summary: Configures the width trigger Source, Level, ThresholdLow, ThresholdHigh, Polarity, and Condition. A width trigger occurs when a pulse, that passes through Level, with a width between or outside, the width thresholds is detected.

member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDigitizerArmMultiArm interface.

member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDigitizerArmSources interface.

member.summary: Specifies the delay from when the arm logic is satisfied until the waiting for trigger state is entered. The units are seconds.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArm.OutputEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether or not an accepted arm appears at an output of the digitizer.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmEdge
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant edge arming interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmEdge.Configure(System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSlopeEnum)
member.summary: This function sets the edge arming attributes. An edge occurs when the arm signal that the end-user specifies with the Source parameter passes through the voltage threshold that the end-user specifies with the Level parameter and has the slope that the end-user specifies with the Slope parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the Arm Type is Edge Arm. Set the Arm Type and Arm Coupling before calling this function. If the arm source is one of the analog input channels, an application program should configure the vertical range, vertical coupling, probe attenuation, and the maximum input frequency before calling this function.
member.param: Specifies the arm level. This value sets the Trigger Level attribute.
Specifies the trigger slope. This value sets the Trigger Slope attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmEdge.Slope
member.summary: Specifies whether a rising or a falling edge arms the digitizer. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the Arm Type attribute is set to Edge Arm.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmGlitch
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant glitch arming interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmGlitch.Configure(System.Double,System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchPolarityEnum,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionEnum)
member.summary: This function configures the glitch arm. A glitch arm occurs when the arm signal has a pulse with a width that is less than or greater than the glitch width. The end user specifies which comparison criterion to use with the GlitchCondition parameter. The end-user specifies the glitch width with the GlitchWidth parameter. The end-user specifies the polarity of the pulse with the GlitchPolarity parameter. The arm does not actually occur until the edge of a pulse that corresponds to the GlitchWidth and GlitchPolarity crosses the threshold the end-user specifies in the TriggerLevel parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the arm type is Glitch Arm. Set the arm type and arm coupling before calling this function.
member.param: Specifies the arm level. This value sets the Arm Level attribute.
Specifies the glitch arming glitch width in seconds. This value sets the Glitch Width attribute.
Specifies the glitch polarity. This value sets the Glitch Polarity attribute.
Specifies the glitch condition. This value sets the Glitch Condition attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmGlitch.Condition
member.summary: Specifies the glitch condition. This attribute determines whether the glitch arm happens when the digitizer detects a pulse with a width less than or greater than the width value.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmGlitch.Width
member.summary: Specifies the glitch width. The units are seconds. The digitizer triggers when it detects a pulse with a width less than or greater than this value, depending on the Glitch Condition attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmGlitch.Polarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the glitch that arms the digitizer.

member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant runt arming interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmRunt.Configure(System.Double,System.Double,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum)
member.summary: This function configures the runt arm. A runt occurs when the arm signal crosses one of the runt thresholds twice without crossing the other runt threshold. The end-user specifies the runt thresholds with the RuntLowThreshold and RuntHighThreshold parameters. The end-user specifies the polarity of the runt with the RuntPolarity parameter. This function affects instrument behavior only if the arm type is Runt Trigger. Set the arm type and trigger coupling before calling this function.
member.param: Sets the runt triggering low threshold in volts.
Sets the runt triggering high threshold in volts.
Sets the runt polarity.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmRunt.Polarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the runt that arms the digitizer.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmRunt.ThresholdHigh
member.summary: The high threshold the digitizer uses for runt arming. The units are Volts.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmRunt.ThresholdLow
member.summary: The low threshold the digitizer uses for runt arming. The units are Volts.

member.summary: This function configures the digitizer for TV arming. It configures the TV signal format, the event and the signal polarity. This function affects instrument behavior only if the arm type is TV Arm. Set the Arm Type and Arm Coupling before calling this function.

Specifies the TV arm event. This value sets the TV Arm Event attribute.
Specifies the polarity of the TV arm signal. This value sets the TV Arm Polarity attribute.

member.summary: Specifies the event on which the digitizer arms.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmTV.LineNumber
member.summary: Specifies the line on which the digitizer arms. The driver uses this attribute when the TV Arm Event is set to TV Event Line Number. The line number setting is independent of the field. This means that to arm on the first line of the second field, the user must configure the line number to the value of 263 (if we presume that field one had 262 lines).

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiArm
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant multi-arm interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiArm.Configure(System.String,Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorEnum)
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to arm based on multiple arm sources. The digitizer can be instructed to arm when any one of multiple arm source conditions are met or when all specified arm source conditions are met.
member.param: A comma separated list of source names to be used in a multi arm scenario. The driver uses this value to set the Arm Source List attribute.
Specifies the boolean operation to apply to the arm sources specified by the SourceList parameter. The driver uses this value to set the Arm Source Operator attribute

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiArm.SourceList
member.summary: A comma separated list of source names to be used in a multi arm scenario. This attribute only affects instrument behavior when the Arm Source Operator attribute is set to AND or OR. When Arm Source Operator is set to AND, the arm conditions associated with each source in this list must be simultaneously satsified in order to arm the digitizer. When Arm Source Operator is set to OR, the first arm source in the list that satisfies its arm conditions will arm the digitizer. Any valid name used for the Arm Source attribute may be used in this list. An arm source may appear only once in the list. If a name in the list is not recognized, the driver returns the Unknown Channel Name error. See IVI-3.2 for the definition of this error.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiArm.SourceOperator
member.summary: Specifies the boolean operation to apply to the arm sources specified by the Arm Source List attribute. See the definition of that attribute for details.

member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant multi-trigger interface.

member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger based on multiple trigger sources. The digitizer can be instructed to trigger when any one of multiple trigger source conditions are met or when all specified trigger source conditions are met.
member.param: A comma separated list of source names to be used in a multi trigger scenario. The driver uses this value to set the Trigger Source List attribute.
Specifies the boolean operation to apply to the trigger sources specified by the SourceList parameter. The driver uses this value to set the Trigger Source Operator attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiTrigger.SourceList
member.summary: A comma separated list of source names to be used in a multi trigger scenario. This attribute only affects instrument behavior when the Trigger Source Operator attribute is set to AND or OR. When Trigger Source Operator is set to AND, the trigger conditions associated with each source in this list must be simultaneously satsified in order to trigger the digitizer. When Trigger Source Operator is set to OR, the first trigger source in the list that satisfies its trigger conditions will trigger the digitizer. Any valid name used for the Trigger Source attribute may be used in this list. A trigger source may appear only once in the list. If a name in the list is not recognized, the driver returns the Unknown Channel Name error. See IVI-3.2 for the definition of this error.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerMultiTrigger.SourceOperator
member.summary: Specifies the boolean operation to apply to the arm sources specified by the Arm Source List attribute. See the definition of that attribute for details.

This attribute affects instrument behavior only when the Trigger Type is set to one of the following values: Edge Trigger, Glitch Trigger, or Width Trigger. member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerArmSource.Level
member.summary: Specifies the voltage threshold for the arm sub-system. The units are Volts. This attribute affects instrument behavior only when the Arm Type is set to one of the following values: Edge Trigger, Glitch Trigger, or Width Trigger. This attribute, along with the Arm Slope, Arm Source, and Arm Coupling attributes, defines the trigger event when the Arm Type is set to Edge Trigger.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelDownconversion
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant downconversion interface.

member.name: M:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelDownconversion.Configure(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures how the digitizer performs downconversion.
member.param: Enables or disables downversion. The driver uses this value to set the Downconversion Enabled attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the center frequency, in Hz, from which the digitizer should downconvert. The driver uses this value to set the Downconversion Center Frequency attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelDownconversion.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables downconversion. When enabled, the Read and Fetch functions return data according to the setting of the Fetch IQ Interleaved Data attribute.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelDownconversion.CenterFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the center frequency, in Hz, from which the digitizer should downconvert.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelDownconversion.IQInterleaved
member.summary: Controls how the Read and Fetch functions return data when downconversion is enabled. When this attribute is True and downconversion is enabled, the data returned from the Read and Fetch functions is interleaved I-Q data points. When this attribute is False and downconversion is enabled, the Read and Fetch functions return data with all I data points in sequence followed by all Q data points. This attribute has no effect when the Downconversion Enabled attribute is False.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant acquistion status interface.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus.IsIdle
member.summary: Returns whether the device is currently in the Idle state. If the driver cannot query the digitizer to return its state, the driver returns the value Unknown.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus.IsMeasuring
member.summary: Returns whether the device is currently in the Measuring state. If the driver cannot query the digitizer to return its state, the driver returns the value Unknown.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus.IsWaitingForArm
member.summary: Returns whether the device is currently in the Waiting For Arm state. If the driver cannot query the digitizer to return its state, the driver returns the value Unknown.

member.name: P:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerAcquisitionStatus.IsWaitingForTrigger
member.summary: Returns whether the device is currently in the Waiting For Trigger state. If the driver cannot query the digitizer to return its state, the driver returns the value Unknown.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IIviDigitizerChannelMultiRecordMeasurement
member.summary: IVI Digitizer class-compliant multi-record measurement interface.
This function returns the (multi-record) waveform the digitizer acquired for the specified channel. The waveform is from a previously initiated acquisition.
member.param: Specifies the number of the first record to read.
Specifies the number of consecutive records to read.
Specifies the start index within the record from which the data should be retrieved
Specifies the number of data points per record to return. This number may be larger than the amount of data available.
Buffer into which the acquired waveform is stored.
Indicates how many records in the acquisition completed successfully.
Indicates how many data points were actually retrieved from the instrument for each completed record. This is an array of size at least NumRecords or a NULL pointer.
Indicates the index of the first valid data point in the output data array for each completed record.
The time in relation to the Trigger Event of the first point in the waveform in seconds. Negative values mean that the first point in the waveform array was acquired before the trigger event.
Specifies the seconds portion of the absolute time at which the first data point was acquired. Note that the actual time is the sum of InitialXTimeSeconds and InitialXTimeFraction.
Specifies the fractional portion of the absolute time at which the first data point was acquired. Note that the actual time is the sum of InitialXTimeSeconds and InitialXTimeFraction.
The time between points in the acquired waveform in seconds.
Scaling factor for the waveform data.
Scaling offset for the waveform data.

member.summary: A positive (rising) edge passing through the trigger level triggers the digitizer.

member.summary: The digitizer triggers on a positive glitch.

member.summary: The digitizer triggers on a negative glitch.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerGlitchPolarityEither
member.summary: The digitizer triggers on either a positive or negative glitch.

member.summary: Defined values values for glitch trigger condition.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionEnum.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionLessThan
member.summary: The digitizer triggers when the pulse width is less than the value you specify with the Glitch Width attribute.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionEnum.IviDigitizerGlitchConditionGreaterThan
member.summary: The digitizer triggers when the pulse width is greater than the value you specify with the Glitch Width attribute.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum
member.summary: Defined values for runt trigger polarity

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityPositive
member.summary: The digitizer triggers on a positive runt. A positive runt occurs when a rising edge crosses the low runt threshold and does not cross the high runt threshold before re-crossing the low runt threshold.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityNegative
member.summary: The digitizer triggers on a negative runt. A negative runt occurs when a falling edge crosses the high runt threshold and does not cross the low runt threshold before re-crossing the high runt threshold.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerRuntPolarityEither
member.summary: The digitizer triggers on either a positive or negative runt.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTVTriggerPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerTVTriggerPolarityNegative
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on a negative video sync pulse.

member.summary: Defined values for width trigger Condition

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthConditionEnum.IviDigitizerWidthConditionWithin
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on signals when they enter the given triggering window. The end-user specifies the high and low thresholds with the Window Trigger High Threshold and Window Trigger Low Threshold properties.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthConditionEnum.IviDigitizerWidthConditionOutside
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on signals when they leave the given triggering window. The end-user specifies the high and low thresholds with the Window Trigger High Threshold and Window Trigger Low Threshold properties.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEnum
member.summary: Defined values for width trigger Polarity

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityPositive
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on positive pulses that have a width that meets the condition the user specifies with the Width Condition attribute.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityNegative
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on negative pulses that have a width that meets the condition the user specifies with the Width Condition attribute.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEnum.IviDigitizerWidthPolarityEither
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on either positive or negative pulses that have a width that meets the condition the user specifies with the Width Condition attribute.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWindowConditionEnum
member.summary: Defined values for window trigger Condition.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWindowConditionEnum.IviDigitizerWindowConditionEntering
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on pulses that have a width that is less than the high threshold and greater than the low threshold. The end-user specifies the high and low thresholds with the Width High Threshold and Width Low Threshold properties.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerWindowConditionEnum.IviDigitizerWindowConditionLeaving
member.summary: Configures the digitizer to trigger on pulses that have a width that is either greater than the high threshold or less than a low threshold. The end-user specifies the high and low thresholds with the Width High Threshold and Width Low Threshold properties.

member.summary: The method waits indefinitely for the measurement to complete.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorEnum
member.summary: Defined values for the arm source operator.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorAND
member.summary: Arm sources are AND'd together. The digitizer arms when all configured arm source conditions are satisfied.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorOR
member.summary: Arm sources are OR'd together. The digitizer arms when the first configured arm source condition is satisfied.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerArmSourceOperatorNone
member.summary: No operator is applied to the configured list of arm sources. The arm source list is ignored, and the digitizer arms when the currently configured arm source, given by the Arm Source attribute, and its associated arm conditions are satisfied.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorEnum
member.summary: Defined values for the trigger source operator.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorAND
member.summary: Trigger sources are AND'd together. The digitizer triggers when all configured trigger source conditions are satisfied.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorOR
member.summary: Trigger sources are OR'd together. The digitizer triggers when the first configured trigger source condition is satisfied.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerSourceOperatorNone
member.summary: No operator is applied to the configured list of trigger sources. The trigger source list is ignored, and the digitizer triggers when the currently configured trigger source, given by the Trigger Source attribute, and its associated trigger conditions are satisfied.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerSampleModeEnum
member.summary: Defined values for acquisition SampleMode.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerSampleModeEnum.IviDigitizerSampleModeRealTime
member.summary: Real-time sampling is used.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerSampleModeEnum.IviDigitizerSampleModeEquivalentTime
member.summary: Equivalent-time sampling is used.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierEnum
member.summary: Defined values for trigger modifier.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierNone
member.summary: The digitizer waits until the trigger the end-user specifies occurs.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierAuto
member.summary: The digitizer automatically triggers if the configured trigger does not occur within the digitizer timeout period.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierEnum.IviDigitizerTriggerModifierAutoLevel
member.summary: The digitizer adjusts the trigger level if the trigger the end-user specifies does not occur.

member.name: T:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerAcquisitionStatusResultEnum

member.summary: The digitizer is currently in the Idle state.

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerAcquisitionStatusResultEnum.IviDigitizerAcquisitionStatusResultFalse
member.summary: The digitizer is not currently in the Idle state..

member.name: F:Ivi.Digitizer.Interop.IviDigitizerAcquisitionStatusResultEnum.IviDigitizerAcquisitionStatusResultUnknown
